author: Anonymous Calc
title: 2021w1-mt1 P3
question:
Hello,
For this question I was wondering why the @dd-template-rules included self-reference? The false, "A", and "B", cases are all atomic-distinct, and (make-one String Farfle) is compound, where is the self referential case?
student_answer:
i was also confused cause I didn't see a "ListOf..." so i went to office hours to ask. They said whenever you see (make-...) it is a compound. And then they pointed out Farfle -> Farfle. It completely went over my head. I didn't see the Farfle ->self-ref-> Farfle because i was looking for "ListOf"
If it was something like (make-one String Natural) then it would have just been compound.
Hopefully I'm making sense haha
instructor_answer:
Remember that in a ListOfString type comment the (cons String ListOfString) is a compound. 

Does that help?
